message.content: This question requires knowledge about incandescent light bulbs and the properties of tungsten. Incandescent light bulbs work by passing an electric current through a tungsten filament, which causes the filament to become extremely hot and emit visible light. Option (A) is partially correct, as incandescent light bulbs do get very warm, but it does not fully explain how they work. Option (B) is incorrect because filaments do not freeze. Option (D) is incorrect because the filament does not catch fire, rather it becomes hot and glows. Option (C) is the correct answer because the glowing filament is what produces the light in an incandescent light bulb.

This question requires basic knowledge about how incandescent light bulbs work. Incandescent light bulbs produce light by heating a tungsten filament until it glows. Option (A) is partially correct because incandescent light bulbs do get warm, but it is not the reason why they produce light. Option (B) is incorrect because filaments are not able to freeze. Option (D) is incorrect because the filament does not catch fire, it simply emits light when heated.
